data.Title: Google Retains Third-Party Cookies in Chrome
data.Description: After years of uncertainty and industry pushback, Google has reversed its decision to phase out third-party cookies in its Chrome browser.

data.Title: Google's AI Overviews Expand with New Features
data.Description: Google is rapidly expanding its AI Overviews in search with new features like saving overviews, link citations, and video descriptions.

data.Title: Bing Tests Related Searches at Top of Results
data.Description: Bing is experimenting with the placement of related searches, moving them to the top of the search results page below the search bar.

data.Title: Google Search Updates: Larger Site Names, Favicons, and More
data.Description: Google is testing several visual updates to its search results, including larger website names, favicons, and a new Sitelinks interface.

data.Title: Google Provides Guidance on Product Rich Results and Internal Links
data.Description: Google's John Mueller offers advice on how to improve SEO, including tips for increasing product rich results visibility and optimizing internal links.

data.Title: Google's Algorithms Combat Negative SEO
data.Description: Google assures users that its algorithms are designed to detect and mitigate the impact of negative SEO tactics on search rankings.

data.Title: Google to Issue Warnings for "Risky" Downloads in Chrome
data.Description: Chrome users will soon encounter full-page warnings for downloads deemed "risky," prompting them to provide a reason for proceeding.

data.Title: Google Notes on Search Data Export Deadline
data.Description: Google reminds users of the approaching deadline to export their Notes on Search data, urging them to download it before it's no longer available.
